name: df-line
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cline, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cdif(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), csn(cv(s1))), crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s4, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s3), co(co(co(cfv(cur, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cfv(csg, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cv(s4)), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s2)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ LineM =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0), s2 ‚àà((Base ` s0)\ { s1 })‚Ü¶ { s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0)| ‚àÉ(s4 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` s0)), s3 =((((1r `(Scalar ` s0))[(-g `(Scalar ` s0))]s4)[(√ó ` s0)]s1)[(+ ` s0)](s4[(√ó ` s0)]s2)))}))
comment: Definition of lines passing through two different points in a left module (or any extended structure having a base set, an addition, and a scalar multiplication). (Contributed by AV, 14-Jan-2023.)
